author: Angeli Gabriel, FOX Weather
title: Michigan truck smashes into emergency vehicles along icy Interstate after winter storm
text:
US News Truck smashes into emergency vehicles along icy Interstate in Michigan By Angeli Gabriel, FOX Weather Published Dec. 13, 2024, 4:27 a.m. ET Originally Published by: Lake-effect snows bring whiteout conditions on I-90 along Lake Erie Brown snow falls on Maine town prompting warning from officials: Don’t eat it Meteorologists surf rare ‘ice wave’ atop Mount Washington Slick roads caused by a winter storm pummeling the Great Lakes area led to a box truck smashing into multiple emergency vehicles.
The crash happened along Michigan’s Interstate 94 on Thursday at about 8:30 a.m. in Comstock Township, according to the Kalamazoo County Sheriff’s Office.
First responders with the sheriff’s office and the Comstock Department of Fire and Rescue were attending to another rollover crash along the eastbound lanes when a 24-foot box truck lost control.
The truck jackknifed, then struck Comstock Fire vehicles and one cruiser with the Kalamazoo County Sheriff’s Office before overturning, officials said.
They noted that no first responders were injured.
The truck driver was taken to a local hospital to treat minor injuries.
“We urge everyone to avoid travel unless absolutely necessary during severe winter weather,” said Kalamazoo County Sheriff Rick Fuller.
3 A box truck plowed into multiple emergency vehicles on Thursday. 3 The crash was caused by slick roads on Interstate 94 in Michigan. Kalamazoo County Sheriff's Office 3 No first responders were hurt but the truck driver went to the hospital. Kalamazoo County Sheriff's Office “If you must be on the road, please use extreme caution, reduce your speed, and allow extra time to reach your destination. Your safety—and the safety of first responders—depends on it.”
The National Weather Service reported that about 5 inches of snow had fallen in Comstock by around 8 a.m.
